import system
	from java.util import Calendar, TimeZone, Locale
	from java.text import SimpleDateFormat
	
	#DEBUG:Ok, so the heatmap graph seems to expect times in UTC, and then it transforms them into local
	#If you pass in local, the time gets transformed twice, and shows up wrong
	#calendar2 = Calendar.getInstance(TimeZone.getTimeZone('UTC'))
	
	# Get the unit conversion factor
	unit_conversion = self.custom.units['unit_conversion']
	total_conversion = self.custom.units['total_conversion']
#	units = str(self.getChild("root").getChild("Selections").getChild("selection_units").props.value)
#	unit_conversion = 1
#	total_conversion = 1
#	if (units == 'gkg'):
#		total_conversion = 1000
#	elif (units == 'olbs'):
#		unit_conversion = 28.3495006561279
#		total_conversion = 453.592010498047
#	else:	
#		for option in self.getChild("root").getChild("Selections").getChild("selection_units").props.options:
#			if (option['value'] == units):
#				unit_conversion = float(option['unit_conversion'])
#				total_conversion = float(option['unit_conversion'])
				
				
	def aggregateData(queryResults, timeZoneId):
	    yearlyData = initializeYearlyData(timeZoneId)
	
	    for record in queryResults:
	        timestamp = system.date.fromMillis(record['time_start'])
	        calendar = Calendar.getInstance(TimeZone.getTimeZone(timeZoneId))
	        calendar.setTime(timestamp)
	        monthIndex = calendar.get(Calendar.MONTH)  # Zero-based indexing for months
	        dayIndex = calendar.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH) - 1  # Zero-based indexing for days
	
	        updateDataStructure(yearlyData[monthIndex]['days'][dayIndex], record)
	        updateDataStructure(yearlyData[monthIndex]['summary'], record)
	
	    # Calculate final values for each day and month
	    for monthData in yearlyData:
	        for dayData in monthData['days']:
	            calculateFinalValues(dayData)
	        calculateFinalValues(monthData['summary'])
	
	    return yearlyData
	
	def initializeYearlyData(timeZoneId):
	    yearlyData = []
	    for month in range(12):  # For each month
	        calendar = Calendar.getInstance(TimeZone.getTimeZone(timeZoneId))
	        calendar.set(Calendar.MONTH, month)
	        
	        # Ok, so the heatmap graph seems to expect times in UTC, and then it transforms them into local
	        # If you pass in local, the time gets transformed twice, and shows up wrong
#	        calendar2 = Calendar.getInstance(TimeZone.getTimeZone('UTC'))
#	        calendar2.set(Calendar.MONTH, month)
	        
	        monthName = calendar.getDisplayName(Calendar.MONTH, Calendar.LONG, Locale.getDefault())
	        yearlyData.append({
	            'days': initializeDaysOfMonth(calendar),
	            'summary': initializeSummaryStructure(monthName)
	        })
	    return yearlyData
	
	def initializeDaysOfMonth(calendar):
	    daysInMonth = []
	    maxDay = calendar.getActualMaximum(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH)
	    year = calendar.get(Calendar.YEAR)
	    month = calendar.get(Calendar.MONTH)
	    for day in range(1, maxDay + 1):  # One-based indexing
	        calendar.set(Calendar.YEAR, year)
	        calendar.set(Calendar.MONTH, month)
	        calendar.set(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH, day)
	        calendar.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 0)  # Set hour to midnight
	        calendar.set(Calendar.MINUTE, 0)       # Set minute to 0
	        calendar.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0)       # Set second to 0
	        calendar.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, 0)  # Ensure millisecond is 0 for completeness
	        
	        timestamp = system.date.toMillis(calendar.getTime())
	        daysInMonth.append({'x': timestamp, 'weight_avg': 0, 'count': 0, 'weight_diff': 0, 'metal_rejects':0, 'weight_rejects':0})
	    return daysInMonth
	
	def initializeSummaryStructure(monthName):
	    summary = initializeDataStructure()
	    summary['x'] = monthName
	    return summary
	
	def initializeDataStructure():
	    return {'weight_avg': 0, 'count': 0, 'weight_diff': 0, 'metal_rejects':0, 'weight_rejects':0}
	
	def updateDataStructure(data, record):
	    data['weight_avg'] += record['weight_sum']
	    data['count'] += record['count']
	    
	    if(record['metal_rejects']):
	    	data['metal_rejects'] += int(record['metal_rejects'])
	    
	    if(record['weight_rejects']):
	    	data['weight_rejects'] += int(record['weight_rejects'])
	    
	    data['weight_diff'] += record['weight_diff']
	
	def calculateFinalValues(data):
	    if data['count'] > 0:
	        #data['weight_avg'] = data['weight_avg'] / data['count']
	        data['weight_avg'] = float(data['weight_avg'] / data['count'])/unit_conversion
	   	#data['weight_diff'] = data['weight_diff'] * self.custom.scale.conversion_factor / 1000
	   	data['weight_diff'] = data['weight_diff'] / total_conversion
	
	timeZoneId = self.params.timeZoneID
	aggregatedData = aggregateData(value, timeZoneId)
	self.getChild("root").getChild("Data").getChild("ScrollBack").meta.visible = True
	self.getChild("root").getChild("Data").getChild("ScrollForward").meta.visible = True
	
	return aggregatedData

#CORE_P.Utils.errorPopup('DEBUG:' + str(value) + ' - ' + str(self.getChild("root").getChild("Selections").getChild("selection_material").props.value))

	from java.util import Calendar, TimeZone

	if self.custom.selection.timestamp == '':
	    return []
	
	# Assuming start_timestamp is provided or determined somehow
	start_timestamp = self.custom.selection.timestamp
	
	# Get the time zone ID from a session property or another source
	timeZoneId = self.params.timeZoneID
	tz = TimeZone.getTimeZone(timeZoneId)
	
	# Generate the list of all hourly timestamps
	all_hours = [start_timestamp + 3600000 * i for i in range(24)]
	
	# Convert the value list to a dictionary for easier access
	data_dict = {bucket["time_start"]: bucket for bucket in value}
	
	# Transform the data
	transformed_data = []
	for hour_timestamp in all_hours:
	    # Create a calendar instance set to the hour_timestamp and the specified time zone
	    cal = Calendar.getInstance(tz)
	    cal.setTimeInMillis(hour_timestamp)
	
	    # Format the hour string
	    hour_str = '{:02d}:00'.format(cal.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY))
	
	    bucket = data_dict.get(hour_timestamp)
	
	    if bucket:
	        # Data exists for this hour
	        y_values = [
	            bucket["weight_min"],
	            bucket.get("percentile25", 0),
	            bucket.get("percentile50", 0),
	            bucket.get("percentile75", 0),
	            bucket["weight_max"]
	        ]
	        if bucket["material"] != 0.0:
	        	material = bucket["material"]
	        else:
	        	material = "None"
	    else:
	        # No data for this hour, use empty or placeholder values
	        y_values = []
	        material = 'None'
	
	    transformed_item = {
	        "x": hour_str,
	        "y": y_values,
	        "material": material
	    }
	    transformed_data.append(transformed_item)
	
	return transformed_data

    if self.custom.selection.timestamp == '':

    # Generate the list of all hourly timestamps
    all_hours = [start_timestamp + 3600000 * i for i in range(24)]

    # Convert the value list to a dictionary for easier access
    data_dict = {bucket["time_start"]: bucket for bucket in value}

    # Transform the data
    transformed_data = []
    for hour_timestamp in all_hours:
        # Create a calendar instance set to the hour_timestamp and the specified time zone
        cal = Calendar.getInstance(tz)
        cal.setTimeInMillis(hour_timestamp)

        # Format the hour string
        hour_str = '{:02d}:00'.format(cal.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY))

        bucket = data_dict.get(hour_timestamp)

        if bucket:
            # Data exists for this hour
            y_values = bucket["count"]
        else:
            # No data for this hour, use empty or placeholder values
            y_values = 0

        transformed_item = {
            "x": hour_str,
            "y": y_values
        }
        transformed_data.append(transformed_item)

    return transformed_data

from java.util import Calendar, TimeZone

    if self.custom.selection.timestamp == '':
        return []

    # Assuming start_timestamp is provided or determined somehow
    start_timestamp = self.custom.selection.timestamp

    # Get the time zone ID from a session property or another source
    timeZoneId = self.params.timeZoneID
    tz = TimeZone.getTimeZone(timeZoneId)

    # Generate the list of all hourly timestamps
    all_hours = [start_timestamp + 3600000 * i for i in range(24)]

    # Convert the value list to a dictionary for easier access
    data_dict = {bucket["time_start"]: bucket for bucket in value}

    # Transform the data
    transformed_data = []
    for hour_timestamp in all_hours:
        # Create a calendar instance set to the hour_timestamp and the specified time zone
        cal = Calendar.getInstance(tz)
        cal.setTimeInMillis(hour_timestamp)

        # Format the hour string
        hour_str = '{:02d}:00'.format(cal.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY))

        bucket = data_dict.get(hour_timestamp)

        if bucket:
            # Data exists for this hour
            # Check if 'sp_plc' is present and has a value; if not, fall back to 'sp'
            #y_values = bucket.get('sp_plc', bucket.get('sp', None))
            y_values = bucket.get('sp')
        else:
            # No data for this hour, use empty or placeholder values
            y_values = None

        transformed_item = {
            "x": hour_str,
            "y": y_values
        }
        transformed_data.append(transformed_item)

    return transformed_data

import datetime
    SeriesIndex=-1
    
    end_dt = self.custom.end_dt
	
    # Get the current month and year
    #current_month = datetime.datetime.now().month
    #current_year = datetime.datetime.now().year
    current_month = end_dt.getMonth()+1
    current_year = end_dt.getYear()+ 1900

    # Custom sorting function to correctly order months with respect to the current month and year
    def sort_key(entry):
        month_name = entry["name"]
        month_number = month_to_number.get(month_name, -1)
        entry_year = entry.get("year", current_year)

        # Calculate how far back in time each entry is from the current month and year
        year_diff = current_year - entry_year
        month_diff = current_month - month_number

        # For entries from the previous year, adjust month_diff to reflect their actual distance from the current month
        if year_diff > 0:
            month_diff += 12

        return (year_diff, month_diff)

    month_to_number = {
        "January": 1, "February": 2, "March": 3, "April": 4,
        "May": 5, "June": 6, "July": 7, "August": 8,
        "September": 9, "October": 10, "November": 11, "December": 12
    }

    monthlyData = value['aggregator']

    transformedData = []

    for month in monthlyData:
        monthName = month["summary"]["x"]
        dayData = month["days"]

        monthDataArray = []
        allDaysAreZero = False # Set to true if empty months should not be shown
        for day in dayData:
            dayNumber = day["x"]
            weight_diff = day["weight_diff"]
            weight_avg = day["weight_avg"]
            count = day["count"]
            
            if count>0:
            	#avg_diff = weight_diff/count*1000/self.custom.scale.conversion_factor
            	avg_diff = (float(weight_diff)/count) #* (self.custom.units.total_conversion/self.custom.units.unit_conversion)
            else:
            	avg_diff=0

            if weight_diff != 0 or weight_avg != 0 or count != 0:
                allDaysAreZero = False

            monthDataArray.append({
                "x": dayNumber,
                "y": avg_diff,
                "y2": weight_avg,      # weight_diff as y
                "y3": weight_diff,      # weight_avg as y2
                "y4": count            # count as y3
            })

        if not allDaysAreZero:
            month_number = month_to_number.get(monthName, -1)
            if month_number > current_month:
                inferred_year = current_year - 1
            else:
                inferred_year = current_year

            transformedData.append({
                "data": monthDataArray,
                "name": monthName,
                "year": inferred_year,
                "zIndex": month_number
            })

    # Sort the transformed data using the custom sort key
    transformedData.sort(key=sort_key)

    return transformedData

    # Get the current month and year
    #current_month = datetime.datetime.now().month

    current_month = end_dt.getMonth()+1
    current_year = end_dt.getYear()+ 1900

    # Custom sorting function to correctly order months with respect to the current month and year
    def sort_key(entry):
        month_name = entry["name"]
        month_number = month_to_number.get(month_name, -1)
        entry_year = entry.get("year", current_year)

        # Calculate how far back in time each entry is from the current month and year
        year_diff = current_year - entry_year
        month_diff = current_month - month_number

        # For entries from the previous year, adjust month_diff to reflect their actual distance from the current month
        if year_diff > 0:
            month_diff += 12

        return (year_diff, month_diff)

    month_to_number = {
        "January": 1, "February": 2, "March": 3, "April": 4,
        "May": 5, "June": 6, "July": 7, "August": 8,
        "September": 9, "October": 10, "November": 11, "December": 12
    }

            else:
            	avg_diff=0

            if weight_diff != 0 or weight_avg != 0 or count != 0:
                allDaysAreZero = False

            monthDataArray.append({
                "x": dayNumber,

                "y3": metal_rejects, #weight_avg,      # weight_diff as y
                #"y3": weight_diff,      # weight_avg as y2
                "y4": count            # count as y3
            })

        if not allDaysAreZero:
            month_number = month_to_number.get(monthName, -1)
            if month_number > current_month:
                inferred_year = current_year - 1
            else:
                inferred_year = current_year

            transformedData.append({
                "data": monthDataArray,
                "name": monthName,
                "year": inferred_year,
                "zIndex": month_number
            })

    # Sort the transformed data using the custom sort key
    transformedData.sort(key=sort_key)

    return transformedData

return CORE_P.Time.currentTimestamp()

# Create an empty dictionary to hold the results
    result = {}

    # Check if the dataset contains at least one row
    if value.getRowCount() > 0:
        # Extract values from the first row
        line_desc = value.getValueAt(0, "line_desc")
        line_weight_min = value.getValueAt(0, "line_weight_min")
        line_weight_max = value.getValueAt(0, "line_weight_max")

        # Assign these values to the keys 'design' and 'setpoint' in the result dictionary
        result['Description'] = line_desc
        result['MinWeight'] = line_weight_min
        result['MaxWeight'] = line_weight_max
    else:
        # Handle the case where no rows are returned
        result['Description'] = ''
        result['MinWeight'] = 20000
        result['MaxWeight'] = 30000

    # Return the dictionary containing the design and setpoint
    return result

#	logger = system.util.getLogger("JAY")
#	logger.warn("Updating scale info" + str(''))
    # Create an empty dictionary to hold the results
	result = {}
	
	# Check if the dataset contains at least one row
	if len(value)> 0:
	    # Extract values from the first row
	    filler_design 	= value[0]["filler_design"]
	    filler_sp 		= value[0]["filler_sp"]
	    unit_name 		= value[0]["unit_name"]
	    unit_conversion	= value[0]["unit_conversion"]
	    scale_name 		= value[0]["scale_name"]
	
	    # Assign these values to the keys 'design' and 'setpoint' in the result dictionary
	    result['design'] 	= filler_design
	    
	    result['setpoint']	= filler_sp
	    result['unit']		= str(unit_name)
	    result['conversion_factor'] 	= unit_conversion
	    result['scale_name'] 			= scale_name
	  #  logger.warn("Updating scale info - found this one: " + str(result))
	else:
	    # Handle the case where no rows are returned
	    result['design'] = 50
	    result['setpoint'] = 25000
	    result['unit'] = 'g'
	    result['conversion_factor'] = 1
	    result['scale_name'] = 'Scale'
	 #   logger.warn("Updating scale info - using default: " + str(result))
	
	# Convert from original unit to grams
	result['setpoint'] = result['setpoint'] * result['conversion_factor']
	result['design'] = result['design'] * result['conversion_factor']
	
	# Then, convert to current display units 
	result['setpoint'] = result['setpoint'] / self.custom.units['unit_conversion']
	result['total_design'] = float(result['design']) / self.custom.units['total_conversion']
	result['design'] = float(result['design']) / self.custom.units['unit_conversion']
	result['unit'] = str(self.custom.units['individual_units'])
	result['conversion_factor'] = 1
	#logger.warn("scaled values: " + str(result))
	 
	
	# Return the dictionary containing the design and setpoint
	return result

# Get the unit conversion factor
	units = str(self.getChild("root").getChild("Selections").getChild("selection_units").props.value)
	unit_conversion = 1
	total_conversion = 1
	individual_units = units
	total_units = units
	
	if (units == 'gkg'):
		total_conversion = 1000
		individual_units = 'g'
		total_units = 'kg'
	
	elif (units == 'olbs'):
		unit_conversion = 28.3495006561279
		total_conversion = 453.592010498047
		individual_units = 'oz'
		total_units = 'lbs'		
	else:	
		for option in self.getChild("root").getChild("Selections").getChild("selection_units").props.options:
			if (option['value'] == units):
				unit_conversion = float(option['unit_conversion'])
				total_conversion = float(option['unit_conversion'])
	return {
		'individual_units':individual_units,
		'total_units':total_units,
		'unit_conversion': unit_conversion, 
		'total_conversion':total_conversion
	}

onChange.script:
try:
		from java.util import Calendar, TimeZone
		
		# Get the timezone ID from a session property or another source
		timeZoneId = self.view.params.timeZoneID
		tz = TimeZone.getTimeZone(timeZoneId)
		
		self.refreshBinding("custom.aggregator")
		self.refreshBinding("custom.aggregator_day")
		self.refreshBinding("custom.aggregator_day_bag")
		self.refreshBinding("custom.aggregator_day_sp")
		
		 # Retrieve the year from the series data
		series_year = self.custom.aggregator_year[self.custom.selection.index_series].year
		
		# Convert to seconds for Python datetime operations
		timestamp_seconds = self.custom.aggregator_year[self.custom.selection.index_series].data[self.custom.selection.index_day].x / 1000.0
		
		# Create a calendar instance, set the time and adjust to the specified timezone
		calendar = Calendar.getInstance(tz)
		calendar.setTimeInMillis(long(timestamp_seconds * 1000))
		
		# Correctly set the year based on the series data
		calendar.set(Calendar.YEAR, series_year)
		
		# Set hour, minute, second, and millisecond to 0 to get the start of the day
		calendar.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 0)
		calendar.set(Calendar.MINUTE, 0)
		calendar.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0)
		calendar.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, 0)
		
		# Convert back to epoch milliseconds adjusted for the specified timezone
		midnight_timestamp = calendar.getTimeInMillis()
		self.view.custom.selection.timestamp = midnight_timestamp
	except:
		return

from java.util import Calendar
	
	input_data = value
	
	# Initialize data arrays
	bag_counts = []
	weight_avgs = []
	weight_diffs = []
	
	# Define month names for mapping numbers back to names later
	month_names = ["January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", 
	               "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December"]
	
	# Convert month names to numbers for sorting
	month_numbers = {name: i + 1 for i, name in enumerate(month_names)}
	
	# Get current year and month
	#calendar = Calendar.getInstance()
	#currentYear = calendar.get(Calendar.YEAR)
	#currentMonth = calendar.get(Calendar.MONTH) + 1  # Adjusting so January is 1, December is 12
	
	end_dt = self.view.custom.end_dt
		
    # Get the current month and year
    #current_month = datetime.datetime.now().month
    #current_year = datetime.datetime.now().year
	currentMonth = end_dt.getMonth()+1
	currentYear = end_dt.getYear()+ 1900
	
	# Determine the year for each month and populate data arrays
	combined_data = []
	for month in input_data:
	    summary = month["summary"]
	    month_number = month_numbers[summary["x"]]
	    year = currentYear if month_number <= currentMonth else currentYear - 1
	    bag_count = float(summary.get("count", 0))
	    weight_avg = float(summary.get("weight_avg", 0.0)) #/unit_conversion
	    weight_diff = float(summary.get("weight_diff", 0.0)) #/total_conversion
	    metal_rejects = float(summary.get("metal_rejects", 0.0))
	    weight_rejects = float(summary.get("weight_rejects", 0.0))
	    
	    combined_data.append([year, month_number, bag_count, weight_avg, weight_diff, metal_rejects, weight_rejects])
	
	# Sort the combined_data by year and month_number
	combined_data.sort(key=lambda x: (x[0], x[1]))
	
	# Replace month_number with month names for display, using the month_names list
	for row in combined_data:
	    row[1] = month_names[row[1] - 1]  # Convert month number back to name
	
	combined_headers = ["Year", "Month", "Count", "Weight Avg", "Weight Diff", 'Metal Rejects', 'Weight Rejects']
	combined_dataset = system.dataset.toDataSet(combined_headers, combined_data)
	#CORE_P.Utils.errorPopup(str(CORE_P.Utils.datasetToDicts(combined_dataset )))
	return combined_dataset

t = CORE_P.Time.adjustTimestamp(self.view.custom.end_dt, offset_hours=(3*60*24))
	if (t>CORE_P.Time.currentTimestamp()):	
		t=CORE_P.Time.currentTimestamp()
	else:
		self.meta.visible = False
		self.getSibling("ScrollBack").meta.visible = False
		
	self.view.custom.end_dt = t

from java.util import Calendar, TimeZone

    # Get the timezone ID from a session property or another source
    timeZoneId = self.view.params.timeZoneID
    tz = TimeZone.getTimeZone(timeZoneId)
    
    
    #Hide if no data exists for selected day
	
    # Check if no data exists for the selected day
    if self.props.series[event.seriesIndex].data[event.dataPointIndex].y == 0:
    	self.view.custom.selection.timestamp = ''
        self.view.custom.selection.index_series = ''
        self.view.custom.selection.index_day = ''
        self.view.custom.selection.index_year = ''
        return  # Exit the function if no data
	
	# Hide with second click on same day
    if event.seriesIndex == self.view.custom.selection.index_series and event.dataPointIndex == self.view.custom.selection.index_day:
        self.view.custom.selection.timestamp = ''
        self.view.custom.selection.index_series = ''
        self.view.custom.selection.index_day = ''
        self.view.custom.selection.index_year = ''
        return
        
    #CORE_P.Utils.errorPopup('Event:' + str(event) + str(self.props.series[event.seriesIndex]) + '========' + str(self.props.series[event.seriesIndex].data[event.dataPointIndex].x / 1000.0))
    # 1744588800.0, in pacific time April 14th
    # 1744588800.0
    
    # 1744588800.0, Auckland time
    # 1744588800.0 UTC
    # 1744502400.0, US/Central
    
    # Retrieve the year from the series data
    series_year = self.props.series[event.seriesIndex].year

    # Convert to seconds for Python datetime operations
    timestamp_seconds = self.props.series[event.seriesIndex].data[event.dataPointIndex].x / 1000.0
    
    #offset = CORE_P.Time.getOffsetInHoursFromUTC(timeZoneId)
    #timestamp_seconds = timestamp_seconds + (offset * 3600)
    
    # Create a calendar instance, set the time and adjust to the specified timezone
    calendar = Calendar.getInstance(tz)
    calendar.setTimeInMillis(long(timestamp_seconds * 1000))
    
    
    # Correctly set the year based on the series data
    calendar.set(Calendar.YEAR, series_year)

    #CORE_P.Utils.errorPopup(str(CORE_P.Time.formatDateTime(calendar.getTime(), format = "MMM dd, YYYY hh:mm:ss")) + ' - ' + str(timestamp_seconds))    
    
    # Set hour, minute, second, and millisecond to 0 to get the start of the day
    calendar.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, 0)
    calendar.set(Calendar.MINUTE, 0)
    calendar.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0)
    calendar.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, 0)
    

    
    # Convert back to epoch milliseconds adjusted for the specified timezone
    midnight_timestamp = calendar.getTimeInMillis()
    self.view.custom.selection.timestamp = midnight_timestamp
    
    self.view.custom.selection.index_series = event.seriesIndex
    self.view.custom.selection.index_day = event.dataPointIndex
    self.view.custom.selection.index_year = series_year

# Convert the Python variable 'value' to a string and prepare it for JavaScript injection
	value_str = str(value)
	digits = str(0)
	if (value['individual_units'] == 'oz'):
		digits = str(2)
	elif (value['individual_units'] == 'kg'):
		digits = str(1)
	elif (value['individual_units'] == 'lbs'):
		digits = str(1)		
	
	
	
	# Create the JavaScript function as a string, injecting 'value' correctly
	return ('''function(value, { series, seriesIndex, dataPointIndex, w }) {'''
	        '''\n    // Accessing the data for y, y2, y3, and y4'''
	        '''\n    var data = w.config.series[seriesIndex].data[dataPointIndex];'''
	        '''\n    var y = parseFloat(data.y).toFixed('''+digits+''');  // Main value'''
	        '''\n    var y2 = parseFloat(data.y2).toFixed('''+digits+'''); // Additional value 1'''
	        '''\n    var y3 = parseFloat(data.y3).toFixed('''+digits+'''); // Additional value 2'''
	        '''\n    var y4 = parseFloat(data.y4).toFixed('''+digits+'''); // Additional value 3'''
	        '''\n'''
	        '''\n    // Concatenate the values with slashes in between'''
	        '''\n    return 'Avg. Overage: ' + y + " ''' + value['total_units'] + ''' " + ' / Avg. Weight: ' + y2 + " ''' + value['individual_units'] + ''' "  + ' / Overage: ' + y3+ " ''' + value['total_units'] + ''' "   + ' / Units: ' + y4;'''
	        '''\n}''')

    #Hide if no data exists for selected day

    if self.props.series[event.seriesIndex].data[event.dataPointIndex].y == 0:
    	self.view.custom.selection.timestamp = ''
        self.view.custom.selection.index_series = ''
        self.view.custom.selection.index_day = ''
        self.view.custom.selection.index_year = ''
        return  # Exit the function if no data
	
	# Hide with second click on same day

        self.view.custom.selection.timestamp = ''
        self.view.custom.selection.index_series = ''
        self.view.custom.selection.index_day = ''
        self.view.custom.selection.index_year = ''
        return
    
    # Retrieve the year from the series data
    series_year = self.props.series[event.seriesIndex].year

    timestamp_seconds = self.props.series[event.seriesIndex].data[event.dataPointIndex].x / 1000.0
    
    # Create a calendar instance, set the time and adjust to the specified timezone

    calendar.setTimeInMillis(long(timestamp_seconds * 1000))

    calendar.set(Calendar.SECOND, 0)
    calendar.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND, 0)
    
    # Convert back to epoch milliseconds adjusted for the specified timezone

    self.view.custom.selection.index_series = event.seriesIndex
    self.view.custom.selection.index_day = event.dataPointIndex
    self.view.custom.selection.index_year = series_year
